docs.lead_paragraph: International A3-10 A divided Yugoslavia took to arms as the Yugoslav army used force to take control of several frontier posts from the Slovenian authorities. Slovenian officials estimated dead and wounded at more than 100 on both sides. Page A1
docs.snippet: International A3-10    A divided Yugoslavia took to arms as the Yugoslav army used force to take control of several frontier posts from the Slovenian authorities. Slovenian officials estimated dead and wounded at more than 100 on both sides.  Page A1

docs.lead_paragraph: The 11-month-old international embargo on trade with Iraq is threatening the country with severe malnutrition and a rise in disease among the poor, American and other Western doctors inspecting hospitals this month say. Some senior officials of relief agencies here have begun to criticize the prolonged trade sanctions because of their devastating effect on the general population and the burden they place on humanitarian organizations.

headline.main: Disease Stalks Iraq as Trade Ban Saps Its Strength

docs.snippet: The 11-month-old international embargo on trade with Iraq is threatening the country with severe malnutrition and a rise in disease among the poor, American and other Western doctors inspecting hospitals this month say.    Some senior officials of...

docs.lead_paragraph: A shield to protect humans against Lyme disease is not at hand, but a vaccine to protect dogs became available last summer. Hundreds of thousands of worried dog owners around the country have already flocked to their veterinarians to obtain it. Some leading veterinary scientists, alarmed by the rush for a magic answer to what they feel is sometimes an inflated fear, have urged that the vaccine be used sparingly until more is learned about its effectiveness and long-term safety.

headline.main: Caution Is Urged on Lyme Disease Vaccinations for Dogs
